item.title: T-distribution
item.description:
A t-distributed random variable with \( u\) degrees of freedom is the ratio of a standard normal variable \(Z \sim N(0,1)\) over the square root of a chi-squared variable \(Y \sim \chi^2_{ u}\) divided by its degrees of freedom.

$$ T_ u = rac{Z}{\sqrt{{Y \over u}}}, \quad Z \perp Y $$

Its pdf is given by

\[ f(t) = rac{1}{\sqrt{\pi u} \Gamma({ u \over 2})}\ \cdot rac{1}{\left({t^2 \over u} + 1 ight)^{ rac{ u+1}{2}} } \cdot \Gamma\left({ u+1 \over 2} ight) \]
